reasoning: Prevalence-based chronic pain condition. Discogenic pain affects 18% of population (18,000 per 100k) based on imaging-identified disc degeneration with pain, derived from low back pain epidemiology studies. Estimated as subset of broader LBP burden affecting 4-6% with specific discogenic etiology.
source: Brinjikji W et al. (2015). Systematic literature review of imaging features of spinal degeneration in asymptomatic populations. AJNR Am J Neuroradiol. 36(4):811-816
